VSqZR7zcAId1Io4ATvMxuw.text: I just had this huge urge for some Chinese food but I was too lazy to take an Uber to Chinatown or Ping Pang Pong in Gold Coast. Luxor was our main stay so Rice and Company it is. We were use to having some casual dining when having Chinese food in Vegas. So, we decided to splurge and spoil ourselves to what Luxor had to offer. The hotel isn't the Mirage so I didn't expect it to be on the same tier.   Luckily, we were seated right away with our drink orders taken as well. Our server was prompt and friendly when taking our drink and food orders. Rice and Company doesn't just have Chinese but also a Japanese menu. We ordered the pan fried noodles, Mongolian Beef and Wor Wonton Soup. The quality was there but Service could be better. Our server hardly check on us after we received our food and we had to flag down another server to refill our drinks. What mad up for the bad service was the food and drinks. I had a nice and strong Vodka and red bull while my Mom enjoyed her plum wine.   For sure we'll be back to Luxor rim a few weeks and will give this place another try.

Pw62ULoLguO479O08I1AUQ.text: Birthday dinner. First and foremost, a big KUDOS to David, our server, who really, just made us very comfortable. He was great in explaining the menu options and giving recommendations. He made everything sound so great. We were not disappointed! Good stuff. Ambience was nice. Quite. Background music was decent. Lighting was well and felt comfortable. The place is nice and clean. Food was exceptional! We had the chi chop bang bang roll, calamari, and pot stickers to start. Yum! Fresh roll, crispy but not over cooked calamari. David made the bbq pork and sausage sound so good, I ordered that. Neat! Nice and diced, full of flavor. Wife ordered the Mongolian beef to no disappointment. Juicy glazed beef slices with beautiful onion slices. Peach sake sangria was tasty and fresh and had fresh peaches NOT CANNED SHIT!  Topped the evening off with a birthday bowl of matcha ice cream for my birthday! Props to David for being THAT GUY! Nice dinner. We"love def be back when in town.

eMisYZp4Bi25CEG2FPjmXg.text: Stopped in on the way to see blue man group for a quick snack  Sake tasted really bad and almost made me sick, yes i know what sake tastes like and this was bad  Server also forgot half of our order   Sushi came and it tasted like it was sitting next to a heat lamp on a dirty plate   Skip this

OAqzmTpgN6Q8BWHMJ-r7kA.text: Rice & Company is a bit overpriced and not the best option to go for Asian food on the Strip/LV area but if you have some food credit and not looking to venture too far from the hotel, Rice & Company isn't a bad choice to shoot for.    Rice & Company is located on the upper level of Luxor as you head towards the Mandalay Bay Mall connector.  It's a fairly nice restaurant and has a good view of most of the pyramid area.    Food-wise, you're looking at a standard mix of American Chinese/Japanese cuisine from sushi to entrees like garlic chicken.  I opted for the Mongolian beef to go along with the Yelp vibe which came with white or brown rice.  For one, it's more than enough (probably just enough for two if you both are light eaters) and was alright.  Again, it is fairly Americanized and won't amaze those familiar with the dish.  It's fairly heavy on the sauce too if that's your thing.  The price is probably the most 'eh' part of the experience - $25 for the beef alone (and along with a beer, it came out to be about $40).  Luckily, I had the $20 food credit from Luxor which brought the price down to what it usually should be.    Service was pretty good with the bartenders being fairly open to chat if you'd like.  The wait to get food was fairly nominal as well.  The restaurant wasn't super busy at 7PM surprisingly on a Friday and the bar was pretty open.  These elements plus the nice look to the area probably brings the score up a tad.    All-in-all, R&C isn't here to blow your mind or be completely inedible - it's convenient and relatively harmless if you're really hungry (and have the food credit in hand).

photos.caption: Photo of Rice & Company - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian Beef with brown rice

Fyxe7nOHh8tEjz5xrsx7Vw.text: Great sushi, good meals and good service.  The prices were good. Waitstaff friendly.   Try the saki cocktails. They have a fresh and flavorful touch.

-vRMnMnWaC1imEr6qTbe0A.text: Overall the place was very meh. Since we didn't want to go too far, we decided to try out Rice & Company. It's a bit pricey but fairly reasonable for Vegas standard. I tried the poke bowl appetizer and it was a tad too citrusy for me but still good flavors. My table also ordered garlic noodles with chicken and the dish wasn't advertised as spicy. However, it was very spicy and we weren't warned in advance. The Hong Kong noodles tasted alright but there was way too much sauce that drowned the noodles.  Our server was very friendly though so that helped make the experience better! This is a place to head towards if you are near Luxor and want an average Asian meal.

fueRs4rEZX3EG1pwG7iUQw.text: Another near miss because of the negative reviews.  Apparently some people have had some pretty bad experiences here - not us!  My wife and I very reluctantly went to Rice & Company after reading some of the reviews frankly because we were too tired to venture too far and we were attending a show at the Luxor right next door in about an hour. We were very pleasantly surprised.  We started with the Pot Stickers which were AMAZING and both ordered a cocktail that was very good (I got something with vodka, pear juice, sake, and sierra mist, my wife ordered a pomegranate margarita). For dinner, I ordered the Mongolian beef, which was very good and pleasantly spicy, contrary to what is usually presented as "spicy".  My wife ordered a spicy sushi roll that she also said had a nice heat to it. Our server was friendly and helpful and we enjoyed a nice quiet meal before our show.  I would give 5 stars, but we did feel it was just a bit over-priced.

koRlQiOyVWyrTYn8Y-LfUg.text: We Decided To Try This Place Since We Had A Free $20 Credit From The Play Book Luxor Gave Us Upon Check In. As We Walked Up We Asked To See A Menu To See What They Offered, The Prices Are A Little On The Higher Side. We Decided To Try It Out And The Hostess Had A Little Bit Of An Attitude Because We Asked If We Could Use The Coupon. Well Don't Offer It Then If Your Gonna Be Rude About It...But Anyways We Ordered A Plate Of Chicken Teriyaki For $22 With Rice And Vegetables...It Was Okay Nothing Special For The Price I Think They Fall Under The Same Category As PF Chang's. I Wouldn't Suggest Coming Here It Just Isn't Worth The Money...I Would Suggest Someplace Else.

I had sushi, my sweetie had Mongolian beef, we both agreed that it was some of the best food we have ever had. It was presented beautifully and the flavors were fantastic. HvBwckYEXHt6czohTQ8zIQ.text: This restaurant is in the Luxor and I had a $30 food voucher so I came here. The atmosphere is really nice. it's classy and cozy and not too loud. If you have a voucher, I'd definitely recommend coming here. If not, it's not worth it cause it can get pretty pricy.   Food: - Wicked roll: spicy tuna, yellowtail, avocado, cucumber. Even though this roll sounds pretty basic, it was pretty good!  - Hot Dang: a lot of different fish, tempura crunch, spicy mayo. I was excited for this roll but it tasted kind of weird to me. Like the tempura crunch was a little stale or something? The fish also isn't that fresh, but maybe its just harder to get fresh fish in Nevada? But my boyfriend really liked it so maybe it was just me  Drinks: - Godiva Chocolate Martini: This was really good!!! The drink was strong but the chocolate masked the taste very well - Lychee-Tini: My boyfriend got this drink lol. I really liked this one too!  Service: Super fast! Got everything within 10 minutes and the waitress was really nice  Overall, everything would've cost $60 but we spent around $30 with our voucher. I definitely wouldn't spend $60 here because the rolls weren't anything that special. I do really like the drinks though.

CAeDILUUBPOI5mTBZJNSPQ.text: Not sure why this place only has 3 stars overall.  I have been there numerous times over the past 2 years. Sometimes I get a craving for the Crab/Mango/Cucumber salad and that alone makes me go. They have a good sized menu of choices. I always opt for sushi. The rolls are great. I almost always order some of the house special rolls. They are good sized and I always leave content but a bit pricey. The rolls look great presentation wise. Everytime I post pictures of them on social media people are asking me where they can get the rolls in the pics. Will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Rice & Company - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes these rolls are as good as they look! I cant remember the names of all of them but check this restaurant out!

o9QdzUJbuins7_zLVEPUVQ.text: Sadly a mediocre offering across five entree's and an appetizer. Is it ok Chinese food? Sure. But this is Vegas. And if I feel like I can pay just as much for a meal from my local Chinese place as I did here, and get significantly better food, there's a problem.   Food was bland, uninspired. This coming after a sermon from our waiter that everything was made from scratch.   "Spicy" meals barely had any flavor. Let alone heat.   Took forever to get our appetizer. Our meals followed two minutes later, and 2/5 dishes were cold. So your kitchen screwed up. If we hadn't been walking all day and already waiting 20 minutes, we would've sent it all back and told you to make it again after we had a chance to eat our soups and appetizers.   In closing; bland food. Lengthy food prep process. No spacing between apps and main course. And cold meals.   Not acceptable. Tread lightly here.

K6cDE-8wfRgUkkipp1eA4A.text: First of all, let me begin by saying the staff at Rice & Company made this experience the greatest! We had a reservation for a Saturday night, but when we arrived (30 minutes early to the Luxor), there was absolutely no parking at the valet, in the parking garage the valet at Mandalay.  We searched for the next 40 minutes for parking and finally found it at the valet at the Excalibur and walked over.  Seeing we were obviously not going to make our reservation, I called before the time we were set to get there and told them we'd be late.  They immediately told us it would be no problem and to arrive when we could.  After hiking in high heels from the Excalibur, we arrived a bit of a mess about 20-30 minutes after our original reservation.  We were greated with smiles from the hostess as we apologized numerous times for being late.  She assured us it was alright.  As she walked us to our table, the restaurant was somewhat crowded.  A lovely table was waiting for us in a quiet corner of the restaurant, opposite of the sushi bar side.  I say quiet relatively, as the roof of the restaurant is open and you can hear the noise of the hotel.  There is also not a wall to close in the restaurant from the shopping area, so you can people watch as shoppers walk by.  Due to the open feel of the restaurant, yet the lovely design of it all, it provides a middle-scale feel (if that makes sense - not low class, but not a high-end restaurant either).  The waiter was very helpful, telling us the specials, answering questions and provide quick service and clean-up.  Our beverages were always full. The food was delivered at perfect temperature in a timely manner (to include our appetizer). Modifications were made for allergy concerns. the alcoholic beverage was very tasty. The manager checked on the tables throughout the meal and everything was delicious!  The prices were excellent for what we ordered.  It was a lot of food on the plate, but all of it was welcomed!  We would definitely return!

M8PnzL2WtywhWSHCZhrybQ.text: My husband and I were guests at Luxor and had a $125.00 food voucher to use during our stay. We used it here for two separate dinners. The service is attentive and the location is attractive. Each trip to this restaurant  costs about 65.00. Our first meal consisted of Honey Chicken and Broccoli Beef with steamed rice. These two dishes were plenty for us. The chicken was white meat and the beef was very lean. The sauces and flavors were excellent. Reminded me of PF Chang's or Fats Bistro back home in Sacramento. During our second meal, we had Sweet and Sour chicken and Mongolian Beef, these were even more delicious than what we had ordered the first time! I recommend this restaurant and would return to dine there again.

yJKe1mQ-dmzSK5MtBB7xKg.text: Slow service and weak drinks. Took a customer out to this spot and we both agreed we could've done much better. The sushi and his chicken plate were mediocre at best. Of the places around I would avoid this one. Excellent music played here though .

Uk1gbtRG06FBR0N7GJW5OQ.text: Delightfully impressed! I had the pleasure to visit rice & Co for an event and was not disappointed! The sushi was fresh and delicious. I was in love with the dessert that was served it was like biting into a cloud with such an airy feel and incredible taste! The dessert was perfectly paired with a small berry sauce. IHyL68kKbyKDz3QyFIRMYQ.text: Was a bit surprised with this place, but hey it's Vegas and what did I expect...  We were recently staying at the Luxor and in need of dinner and a Chinese style feast was sounding good to everyone. We got a table immediately and was drinking in the ambiance of this beautiful restaurant when our waiter appeared to take our drink orders. We perused the menu, and I was immediately taken back by the high prices. Once I got over my sticker shock, we ordered dinner and just figured that we also had to pay for the experience along with dinner. It was not long before our food hit the table, my wife got a few sushi rolls that she said were good. I got an order of noodles along with an order of fried rice. My noodles at first glance were sad, a small pile of plain looking noodles swimming in a large bowl. Once I mixed them up they looked a little happier. My noodles had a good chew to them but the whole dish lacked any flavor until the addition of vinegar and soy. My fried rice was tasty and did not need much additional condiments. Overall our dinner was just O.K, the prices were very high for what you got (portions were small) quality was just o.k and the service was good in a beautiful setting. At least now I know what to expect from a fancy Luxor eatery, but next time I'll just hit the buffet, Aloha

fzEihTlxMFYehQZhthnvDA.text: Came here with my family looking for some authentic Chinese (particularly Cantonese) food and we were impressed!  All the dishes were very flavorful, and my mom (who is from Hong Kong) enjoyed it the most.  The food was a little more on the expensive side but nothing too much, and the serving sizes can be made as "family dishes" for people to share (about one person per dish).  On top of that, the restaurant interior is beautiful with statues and ceiling decorations (be sure to look up once at the ceiling)!  The employees are nice.  If you need a place to cool down from excitement and enjoy some good food, this is the place to go.

60GQE5BEtttftwvvYIwfbg.text: Located on the second floor of LUXOR across the blue man's gift shop. We were staying at LUXOR and my brother wanted to eat ramen. Saw their menu and saw that they have ramen on it. I mean we thought it was ramen but it wasn't. I ordered their red dragon and another roll of sushi forgot what it was. Red dragon was good but I've had better. We also got their salt and pepper calamari and oh boy was it salty!! My brother wanted their ramen but the server got him a Singaporean noodle which waa pretty much stir fry with crunchy noodles. My brother was disappointed to say the least. The service did not help with our experience either. Service was slowwwwww. They only checked up on us when they took our bill. The ambiance was nice. But food was mediocre and service was slowwwww. Definitely not coming back here when I'm in Vegas.

K9pTpwPhacGmaY9EmoqzmQ.text: This restaurant has a very romantic atmosphere so my husband and I decided to stop and have dinner here for our last night in Vegas. I can't tell you how the food was because we never ate anything. I ordered the honey chicken and my husband ordered kung pao chicken. When they brought the food our they brought our szechuan chicken instead of honey chicken then the waitress got snippy and argumentative with my husband questioning what we ordered. So we left.

NvBxPpP4GFoHAkLnKeAdgA.text: We had dinner here before the blue man group show.  (Don't wasn't your $on the show) the sushi was fantastic!  My other half really liked the Hot Deng role and the philly.  They were fresh and it was all balanced and each bite was a flavor sensation.  The garlic shrimp on the other hand was quite disappointment, it was like a hunan shrimp with a flavorless clear sauce. The bummer that the waitress felt the need to recommend it.

RC7xlesJzULkojMioI7cgA.text: It was hot as blazes in Vegas so we wanted to eat somewhere in our hotel...  Got a myVegas rewards deal for $50 off $100 for dinner here and it seemed like the best option of the limited dining choices at the Luxor - and the only place that could accommodate a vegetarian (my SO).    The food is pretty bad.  It's like the sort of Chinese/Japanese mishmash you could find in a mall food court.  Only more expensive.    They made some vegetarian sushi (avocado and cucumber) for my SO and I did a shrimp tempura roll.  Both were about the same quality that you'd find at the Ralphs.  And that was the best thing we had all night.    Vegetarian spring rolls were clearly not fresh and tasted like something from the freezer case at a budget grocery.  Garlic noodles were so salty and tasted of only old garlic and soy sauce.  MaPo Tofu could have been the best dish of the night but was undone by a cloyingly sweet sauce.  Vegetable fried rice was just OK... didn't seem fresh.  We ordered the chocolate cake dessert to take back to our room and it was just a lot of dense chocolate with some not very fresh strawberries and a fake tasting strawberry sauce.    Service was fine (although they didn't even ask us if we wanted anything to drink and didn't refill water - nor ask why we didn't finish anything...  I suspect they know).  The dining room is nice.  But this food is definitely not worth it - and it's not that expensive...  we had to order a lot to get to $100 - but we weren't drinking.    I can't recommend this place.   The food is just very not good.  This isn't even passable Asian food.  Only for the service and the relatively nice room do I give it 2-stars...  I'd never go back.

UQh7APWLeUxYL-Bokmi1kA.text: Wow how dissatisfying could a meal be? First it was $300 for 6. A couple of drinks. Portions are small. Not that interesting. The restaurant is pretty enough. The service was fine. The hot food wasn't hot. The dumplings were sorry. Tasted premade   . The sushi was ok. The calamari was popular but I was unimpressed . The noodle dishes were dull for the price. Singapore and lo mein. The chicken dishes for $22 each were a sin. If they have a 10% food cost I'd be shocked . I know it's a Casino but come on. If you charge those prices it should be great , not dismal. I can't tell you how disappointed I was. It's our last night and it was by far our worst meal. Sorry I remembered to take pictures after we were close to done.

AMcoyX9YRrxCTBftUqFn8Q.text: We were staying at Luxor on NYE and needed somewhere to go for dinner. After perusing the options, we decided to try this place out. We made reservations, although we wouldn't have needed them.  We went with some friends and decided to go family style so we could sample a bunch of items. We ordered the pot stickers, chicken chow mein, teriyaki salmon, black pepper beef, honey chicken and the sausage fried rice.  Overall we all thought the food had great flavor. Problem was, the portions were pretty small for what they charge. I know it's the strip and all, however, the portions don't match the prices.  The service was great. Our waters were refilled frequently, plates taken away as we finished, and the server was attentive.  Overall we all enjoyed the meal. Would I go back? Probably not. There's simply better options on the strip. I will say that if you get the MYVegas reward and are able to get the 50$ off $100 that would make it more worth it.

BuacCYTk1xKbOBYlXRBw0A.text: Okay. After walking back and forth from Mandalay Bay to the Luxor multiple times we stayed with our decision to eat dinner at Rice. They do not have a children's menu so my husband and daughter split the honey chicken. Very tasty. My son wanted sushi so I caved in and let him get what he wanted. I ordered a spicy one and tempura shrimp. I was very happy with my choices.   After ordering the Sapporo, I found the Peach Sake Sangria. This was a perfect end to my meal.   Service was solid from Alessandra. She was very nice and knowledgeable of the menu. And involved my children in conversation.   Service was all around excellent.  From the hosts to the bidder to our server..... A++++

0Cv88_CqEds4ap6bcAUP8g.text: Rice & Company is a sushi bar located in the Luxor Hotel. Before being seated we asked the hostess if she recommended eating there and the answer was not inspiring. She kind of gave us a yes, but it was also kind of a no. I laughed and asked for a table thinking that it would be fine for what we wanted.  I ordered the chili garlic edamame which was really good. The Chili Garlic seasoning was a welcome change from the normal salt seasoning that other restaurants use.  I forgot which roll I ordered but it was really good. I was shocked at the wasabi though. It was very mild with almost a sweet taste to it. It was easy to eat and added a pretty good flavor to my roll.  It was a pleasant and quick dinner and I would recommend Rice & Company for anyone who is ok paying ~$30 per person for a dinner. Prices are comparable to the other restaurants we tried, but more expensive than home (Louisville, KY). I'd honesly only come back if it was convenient and I was really hungry.

yZviloboT5H4aAdnms-STA.text: Good food! We like spicy food and while neither dish was as hot as we like it was respectable spicy. We ordered the Mongolian beef  (came with rice) and Singapore noodles. Both were large enough and filled our empty bellies.

cFm5FZqz1mEMvejb5lM5cA.text: There sushi and rolls are fantastic. The entrees flavorful and hearty. Its vegas so prices are higher than your hometown. I've always had excellent service with a very friendly staff.

qJUaCPqUuqWmQhosR_xyvg.text: Actual rating: 3.5 for the food  Service: NOT friendly, the price that I am paying,  kinda expect some decent service  Price:  $$ - $$$   Ordered: Garlic Noodles, Mongolian Beef & bang bang roll  Quality of food: good  Revisit:   maybe  Parking: structure parking, or valet (must have pearl or higher players card/mlife card for free parking if not $10/day)- inside Luxor Casino       Finding space:  moderate   Casual dining Overall: Garlic Noodles: it had a lot of flavor which I love.  there is nothing bland about this dish. I recommend adding shrimp/chicken bc it literally doesn't have anything but noodles.   Mongolian Beef: this dish also had a lot of flavor with a little kick to it.  it had enough sauce for you people who like to mix rice at the end.   Note, you only get a small rice with it. if you order an extra one it is $4 which is not worth it.  I ate it with the noodles.   Bang Bang Roll: this roll had real crab, 8pieces with spicy mayo sauce on the side and pop rock candy. That is why it's called bang bang.  hmmm... It was okay roll for $22 I don't think I'd order again but remember it has real crab.     Drink a lot of water after so you are not dehydrated.    If you thought it was helpful, please hit those buttons [helpful, funny, cool or send me a compliment ]  Thank you and happy eating!

lnyaomUYo2Qc7q3rpzt5AA.text: Amazing place ! Located inside Luxor in the middle of the hotel , service is wonderful and the food is even better ! It was my boyfriend and I 10 year anniversary and we got complementary drinks and dessert which I thought was very nice we also got a happy anniversary card. Great food great service , nice modern decor . We will be back for sure !

BpWCaw9LFG0pEIxHICnNSQ.text: Low rent Chinese. We've honestly had better at the spot near our house in a strip mall. Didn't try the sushi due to how busy the sushi bar was. Food was under seasoned and over sauced. Service wasn't great either.

RiQtpGW1QVYUgKcPGS-LLA.text: DO NOT GO HERE. I never say this, ever. I always give places the benefit of the doubt, and I never say food is bad usually because I love food so much. But this was just straight up terrible: we were waiting for over 1 hour with no drinks at a table in the bar area. The manager even came out a few times, she was made aware of the problem. She got us a couple of shots and comped them but then forgot everything else. There was ONE girl on duty on a busy night. She was literally running around everywhere and nobody was helping her.   Once we finally got our food, it was gross. I ordered Wonton Soup and the pork inside was gristly and fatty. The Pad Thai was fishy-stinky and the shrimps were very fishy also. Just all around gross.   The thing I feel really stupid about, is that we still paid $155 for this slop and terrible service.

MwfoCXTvqGsLKzzRAnNxiA.text: Normally don't write to many reviews,  but this place is a 1 star at best for my dining experience.  The only thing good is the ambiance.  Took 30 minutes for the  server to take my order  at 9:30pm, with no crowd.  Once I got my food it was cold--that's pretty much all it takes for a bad experience.  Cup of noodles is a better option and way cheaper. I don't feel I need to say more.

TrtbfenAvhrfugPPGrLslQ.text: It's in the Luxor hotel and their nicest restaurant. We were here for the Criss Angel show (see review on that). The Luxor doesn't have the same modern casino culture that the bigger hotels have and much fewer eating selections too. Rice and company is Chinese although I had a sushi plate and the hubs pork belly ramen. The other had the Kapo soft tofu with vegetables, broccolini and some noodle stir fry. It was all just ok but I wouldn't repeat it. The rice was horrible single whole grain white rice but texture was better for fried rice than as an accompaniment to the main dishes. So when the main staple is not done well... The service was good.

ZQe9afWSlsSORizwCjtwWQ.text: The place was alright, but I am pretty sure I would have been happier with the food in the food court instead.   Most of the pieces of chicken in my General Tso was very dry, not much flavor and definitely  not worth $24.  My husband did really like his Peking Duck and was happy with his portion size and cost.  The seared Ahi appetizer was pretty good.  Service was slow and food over priced  for the quality.

vCN5i7XY_7ruDxDa_3QeQA.text: This place is actually pretty good, I just have a problem with their prices in relation to what they're serving. Their food is common americanized Asian fare along with a sushi selection. The entrees are similar to what you would find at a nice Asian fusion restaurant such as PF Changs, but it's way overpriced. For example General Tso's Chicken is about $23! Once our food arrived, it was tasty and the staff is very nice, although service was a little slow considering how many servers there were and the restaurant was not very packed. We were staying at the Excalibur and had a $20 food and beverage credit so we used it here. I would only come back if I had similar comp because this place is just too expensive for what you get. The good thing is we didn't leave hungry, so the portions at least are pretty reasonable.

2DpQgKBsBLas4VnAq0zztw.text: Disappointing. While I am loathe to lightly dismiss the culinary efforts of professionals, when significant doubloons are at stake, one must be honest.   The Chop Chop Bang Bang roll really does have Pop Rocks sprinkled on it. The amusement factor of the Pop Rocks is necessary to overcome the mundanity of the roll itself.   The Singapore Noodles smelled amazing, looked wonderful, and were surprisingly bland. Another disappointment. So much potential but yet unfulfilled.   The service staff was very pleasant and nice, so full marks there, but with all the places in LV I could have chosen, well, I chose...poorly.

vyy1T-tGLH8iyNFwnTt38Q.text: Food was good - had Hong Kong Noodles - a portions were appropriate; not oversized as many other restaurants. Server was lukewarm; once we declined on cocktails, he seemed to tune out. Atmosphere was somber, quiet but a bit weird for a Las Vegas restaurant.

tzT4dYuDbXQYUg28pPx5Jw.text: We had Tuna and Salmon Sashimi. Both were firm and very tasty as well as being a good size. The Unagi was also very good, as were the Rainbow Roll and Hot Dang Roll. We sat in the lounge/bar. It was that or wait 5 minutes for a regular table as staff had to make sure they could accommodate parties with reservations. We had no problem with that. The service was good. I just wish they had Creamy Scallops.  We had a $20 credit coupon so that put the total price just a touch higher than we've paid at similar style sushi restaurants. Not a big deal for us. For those who complained about the price in other comments, there is nothing stopping you from looking at a menu before hand, and the food court is right down the hall.

-PceAm76rKJWuizjzxWkxQ.text: I enjoy Vegas and don't mind the higher prices charged at the resorts on The Strip. In return I want an above average experience: an interesting menu, good food and great service.  In my first experience at Rice and Company I got none of the above.  Starting right off the bat, the host and hostess didn't communicate and I went from next-to-be seated (with reservation) to waiting for 2 walk-up groups to be seated ahead of me. They apologized when they realized their mixup, but things started off poorly.  The setting is quite nice and not too noisy. Service was prompt with menu and drinks arriving promptly.  The menu is not remarkable with the "House Specials" the same as on any Chinese menu.  I opted for the Potstickers and Ramen Noodles with Tempura Shrimp off the daily special card. The Potstickers were average and definitely not worth the $13 (for 6) price tag. The noodle dish was excellent (loaded with all sorts of meat and vegetable goodies) even though I found the miso broth a bit salty. The $21 price tag was acceptable.  Bottom line - you can get the same menu items for a lot less at other restaurants or even the buffet.  There are much better upscale Asian restaurants nearby (for example, try Noodles at the Mandalay Bay next door).

photos.caption: Photo of Rice & Company - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raman Noodles with Shrimp Tempura

5Dp9C9a_Q3oXK9b49-JQrA.text: Meh is right.  We sat up at the bar so we could watch football on their 2 TV's there.  I will say the bar staff is very friendly/attentive and will try to strike up a conversation with you. The music, surprisingly, was really good. The decor is right on for a higher end sushi place that also boosts a very nice selection of moderately priced Sake [me=fan].  Got a bottle of sake for under $40 700 ML #score.  Ordered a spicy tuna roll first to share as an appetizer. It was rather bland for me. Definitely needed more spice, rice was a little underdone for me, and overall lacked the depth of flavor I would've necessarily associate with a "spicy tuna roll".  It got a D in my book.    Asked the bartender his favorites he said "Hong Kong noodles" {under $20}. Looked it up has a mixture of pork, shrimp, chicken with lots of veggies on top of noodles. OK so I order it [no mushrooms please-they gross me out] and my friend orders Sesame Chicken which comes with Jasmine or Brown Rice, he goes with the latter choice.  Comes out looks...OK.  Tastes very bland but salty??? WTH?!  So I ask for some Sriracha that should help it....meeeeeh maybe not.  And then I found a couple random mushrooms hiding in there- grossie! So not my favorite meal. I gave it a D  Sesame Chicken was MUCH better but it's fried Chicken in a sticky brown sauce with brown rice, how could one really mess this up?  I gave that one a solid B [it was better than mine].  Total bill for 1 roll, 2 entrees, and sake $88 w/out tip.  So what this place really needs to work on is their food and for a restaurant in Las Vegas, that's a tall order!!!
